channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2024010076
item.description:
Report X-2024010076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-10T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-26
  • City: RALEIGH
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE DUE TO THE RATTLE SOUND OF AN AEROSOL CAN. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED (1) 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CAN OF FLAMMABLE RUST-OLEUM ACRYLIC ENAMEL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023120792
item.description:
Report X-2023120792

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: FLETCHER
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Dec 14th, a package was discovered to be leaking due to a small amount of liquid and smell coming from the package. The outer package was damaged and non-salvageable. It had no markings on the outside that indicated it was DG. The paint can that was on the inside had leaked a small amount of paint and it was marked with UN1263 Paint. The can was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending further disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024010004
item.description:
Report E-2024010004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NCH experienced a UN2735 PRE-TECT 2040HP release from a 2700-pound metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released to the concrete dock floor and pads in a 2’ x 3’ area over the course of 2 weeks while awaiting a new tote for transfer. The release was caused by a steam leaking on the bottom fitting which was secured and contained on the dock. Once the new tote arrived onsite on 12/28/2023, the material was transferred for shipment on. All impacted pads, absorbents, and PPE were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023120616
item.description:
Report X-2023120616

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: RAEFORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UPON ARRIVAL TO THE TERMINAL, PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET AND SMELLING STRONGLY. IT WAS PULLED FROM THE BELT AND PLACED IN A DAMAGE BIN AND GIVEN TO THE QA TEAM FOR INSPECTION. AFTER INSPECING, IT WAS FOUND TO BE A LOOSE CAP ON A BOTTLE OF REAGENT'S FORMIC ACID 90%. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A DAMAGE BIN UNTIL PROCESSED AS A DAMAGE.

item.title: Report E-2023120475
item.description:
Report E-2023120475

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2023, two (2) 48-pound boxes of UN3262 were damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized absorbent pads, a degreasing agent, and bleach to collect any residual product from the impacted area. Crews restacked the undamaged cargo for normal transport. All HA Powder (UN3262) impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 5 Crews utilized hand tools to collect released HA Powder 5-gallon drums and R+L personnel took possession.
